Detailed Description

Helper class to create customizable bitmap contexts.

This class provides an easy way to render text and/or bitmaps in a bigger bitmap. This gives much more flexibility to the developer when using the Bluetooth Printer API. Since, the first implementation of the printing protocol does not support text formatting (changing font, size and alignment), the iBPBitmapContext class provides a workaround that consists in rendering the text on the iOS side and then sending the resulting bitmap for printing. Moreover, the latter can also be used for other purposes like printing it over the air (AirPrint), sending it by E-mail or MMS.

Method Documentation

- (void) clearContext

Clear the bitmap context.

This function clears the bitmap context and erases every text or bitmap that was drawn.

- (void) drawBitmapWithImage: (UIImage *)  image

Draws an image on the bitmap context.

This methods takes an UIImage object and draws it on the bitmap context. If the bitmap width is larger than the width of the context, a scaling factor is applied to make it fit in its container.
Bitmaps can also be aligned (left, center or right) based on the alignment property that is also used to align text.

Parameters
imageUIImage object containing the image to be drawn
- (void) drawBitmapWithImage: (UIImage *)  image
andSize: (CGSize)  bitmapSize 

Draws an image on the bitmap context and binds its size to the.

This method behaves exactly the same as drawBitmap, except that it offers the possibility to change the size of the bitmap through the bitmapSize argument. This is useful when having to print bitmap resources that have different sizes while they need to be drawn with the same width to align them.
When scaling the image object provided as argument according to the bitmapSize parameter, the aspect ratio is preserved and the bitmap is scaled to fit within the width of the context if the provided size exceeds this width.

Parameters
imageUIImage object containing the image to be drawn
bitmapSizeA CGSize structure that specifies the preferred bitmap size
- (CGFloat) drawingPosition

Return the current drawing position within the bitmap context.

Returns
The drawing Y Position within the bitmap context
- (void) drawText: (NSString *)  text

Draws a text string on the bitmap context.

The text string is renderend using the last configured formatting options. Those can be set by changing the values of the following properties:

  • textFont
  • textSize
  • alignment
  • characterSpacing
Parameters
textNSString object containing the text string to be drawn
- (UIImage *) getImage

Return an UIImage object of the content of the bitmap context from the beginning to the drawing position.

This function returns an UIImage object from what has been drawn on the bitmap context, starting from the beginning of the bitmap context to the current drawing position. The image object has the following bitmap configuration:

  • Grayscale color space
  • No alpha channel
  • 1 color component
  • 8 bits per color component

For more information on iOS supported bitmap configurations, please refer to Apple's documentation here here.
The returned UIImage object can be provided as argument to the iBPPrintBitmap of ICAdministation's iBP category in order to print it using the BT printer. It also can be saved in a database, or sent by E-mail or by MMS.

Returns
UIImage object of the content of the bitmap context
- (UIImage *) getImageAt: (int)  yPosition
maxHeight: (int)  maxHeight 

Return an UIImage object of the content of the bitmap context from the beginning to the drawing position.

This function returns an UIImage object containing a sub-image from what is drawn on the bitmap context. It picks the part of the context starting at yPosition and that is maxHeight large at maximum. If maxHeight exceeds the current drawing position reached in the context, the returned image is taken from yPosition until the current drawing Y position.
The image object has the following bitmap configuration:

  • Grayscale color space
  • No alpha channel
  • 1 color component
  • 8 bits per color component

For more information on iOS supported bitmap configurations, please refer to Apple's documentation here here.
The returned UIImage object can be provided as argument to the iBPPrintBitmap of ICAdministation's iBP category in order to print it using the BT printer. It also can be saved in a database, or sent by E-mail or by MMS.

Parameters
yPositionThe starting point in the Y-Axis of the image to be returned
maxHeightThe maximum height of the image to be returned. If the image should go beyond the drawing position reached withinthe bitmap context, only the part before the drawing position is returned.
Returns
UIImage object of the content of the bitmap context
- (id) initWithWidth: (CGFloat)  width
andHeight: (CGFloat)  height 

Initialize the bitmap context with the dimensions provided as arguments.

This method should be called just after constructing an iBPBitmapContext object and before performing any drawing operation.

Parameters
widthWidth of the bitmap context
heightHeight of the bitmap context
Returns
An initialized iBPBitmapContext object
- (void) lineFeed

Move the drawing position a step forward in the vertical direction.

This function moves the drawing Y position a step forward. The step can be changed through the lineFeedStep property.

Property Documentation

- (NSUInteger) alignment
readwritenonatomicassign

The alignment of text or bitmaps within the bitmap context.

This property is to be set with one of the constants of the UITextAlignment enumeration. This will only impact the text or bitmaps that are drawn after changing the property.
The supported alignment configurations are Left, Right and Center.

- (NSUInteger) characterSpacing
readwritenonatomicassign

The spacing between text characters when they are rendered into the bitmap context.

The new character spacing value is applied to the text that follows changing the property.

- (NSUInteger) lineFeedStep
readwritenonatomicassign

The number of pixels to skip in the Y direction when calling lineFeed.

- (NSString*) textFont
readwritenonatomiccopy

The name of the font to be used to be render text within the bitmap context.

This property should be set before issuing the call to drawText so that the text is formatted accordingly. So, this property does only affect the text that is rendered after it is changed and not the one that was added before.
All iOS supported fonts can be used. Those can be retrieved by calling [UIFont familyNames] and [UIFont fontNamesForFamilyName:] of the iOS SDK.

- (NSUInteger) textSize
readwritenonatomicassign

The size of the text to be drawn on the bitmap context.

The size has to be set before drawing the text. The property change will only affect the text that will come after and not the one that was drawn before.
